resources.string: Welcome to \"Phantom of the West\". Please tap \"%s\" to continue.
Playing \"Phantom of the West\" is simple. The story is presented as a series of pages with text, accompanied with images. Tapping \"%s\" will continue to the next page.
Occasionally, you will be presented with multiple choices. Some choices will affect the story more than others. Please tap \"%s\" to see an example of multiple choices.
This is the first choice. Tap \"%1$s\" if you would like to see the second choice, or tap \"%2$s\" to continue.
This is the second choice. Tap \"%1$s\" if you would like to see the first choice, or tap \"%2$s\" to continue.
Finally, tapping \"%1$s\" will open the options menu. When you are ready, please press \"%2$s\" to start the game.
Welcome to \"Phantom of the West\". Please click \"%s\" to continue.
Playing \"Phantom of the West\" is simple. The story is presented as a series of pages with text, accompanied with images. Clicking \"%s\" will continue to the next page.
Occasionally, you will be presented with multiple choices. Some choices will affect the story more than others. Please click \"%s\" to see an example of multiple choices.
This is the first choice. Click \"%1$s\" if you would like to see the second choice, or click \"%2$s\" to continue.
This is the second choice. Click \"%1$s\" if you would like to see the first choice, or click \"%2$s\" to continue.
Finally, you can access options at the top of the screen. When you are ready, please press \"%s\" to start the game.
Chapter 1

My name is Dr. Alexander Kaden. If you can hear me, or at least, read what I\'m saying, then you\'ve come at a good time. This evening, I\'m going to drink an elixir that allows me to possess other people.

That\'s the city of New Ferando out there. It\'s the main port of the western continent. I have lived on this continent since I was young. The people here will be the first to see my making of history. This rainy evening, everything changes.

There is no point in wasting time. I drink the elixir. As I do, I smell the mixture of blood. It was a special kind of blood, and an essential ingredient. It reminds me of how much work it took to make this. I finish the elixir, but there\'s some time left before it\'ll take effect.

I leave my hotel room and walk out to the city below. There are plenty of people walking by the streets, but it\'s not that loud. I\'m a bit excited, and I don\'t feel that a lot nowadays. Once this elixir takes effect, there are a lot of things I can do, and these people around me have no idea what\'s about to happen.
It\'s been some time now, and I don\'t feel well. My mind is spacing out, and I might be getting weaker. I turn into a nearby alley and fall to my knees.
A patrolling police officer notices me and stops in the alley. \"Are you all right, Sir?\" he asks.
I\'m still lightheaded, but I manage to tilt my head up to look at the officer. I cannot feel my own face though. Is it missing?
Just a moment later, I can open my eyes. This has to be it. I\'m as light as vapor now. This is a good opportunity to test my new ability.
Without hesitation, I leap towards the officer. My body is now a black, gaseous mass, and I can feel myself flying. My old pile of clothes is left behind as I absorb myself into the officer.
My hands, my skin, my clothes, they\'re all different. The elixir must have worked.
I need to rest and think about what I\'ll do. I find the officer\'s car nearby and drive to his home. I didn\'t really need to think about where this officer lived. It just came naturally to me.
I go up into the officer\'s apartment. The bedroom inside is all right. I lie on the bed and nap.
Chapter 2
8 years ago …

I was attending L\'Université de Éclair in the mainland, and was in Prof. Arvin\'s world history lecture at the time. \"Six hundred years ago, the natives of the western continent lived in peace,\" he said. \"Those natives worshiped four gods.\"
\"Sezja was the god of play. Behind his wooden mask was a joyful man with long, flowing hair.\"
\"Baqer was the god of indulgence. He was the chief of the gods, and he basked himself in his own power.\"
\"Va\'Nal was the goddess of romance. Few could resist her beautiful, leafy, green hair.\"
\"Finally, Bek\'Shtii was the god of tradition and the past. While he was not the leader, Bek\'Shtii was perhaps the smartest of the group.\"
I relaxed for the rest of the lecture. \"That is all for today,\" the professor concluded. \"I have my normal office hours, if anyone needs them.\"
After class, I walked to Prof. Arvin\'s office to see him.
\"Hello, Professor,\" I said.
\"Hello, Kaden, what do you need?\"
\"Well, I\'ve been studying for your class, but I\'ve been having a lot on my mind. I\'ve been thinking about other things. I\'m not sure what the best thing to do is.\"

\"Kaden, I am just a professor. I am not a counselor. I am not sure about what you can do. However, whatever the problem is, I hope that you can take care of it so that you can do well here. Take care, Kaden.\" The professor and I shook hands, and I left.
Chapter 3
I wake up, feeling refreshed. I had a feeling that waking up in a different body would be awkward, but I\'m actually adjusting fairly well.
\"Good morning, Sleepy Head!\"

\"Waah! Who are you?\" I ask the man lying next to me, on the bed. He\'s wearing a robe and a wooden tribal mask, the same mask that the natives of the west wore. I assume that he\'s Sezja, one of the native gods. I don\'t see how any other person could have gotten into this room, especially dressed like that.

\"My brother said that he sensed someone drinking his blood, so I just came by to see who it was. Now that that mystery\'s solved, I guess I can leave you alone, for now. Oh, and I\'ll see if I can get the rest of the family to meet you. Ta ta!\" Sezja says, and slides off the edge of the bed.
I lean over the edge to see him, but he\'s gone.

Well, it seems like I\'m almost ready to start my body-hopping adventure in earnest, but I have three more things to worry about. First, I have to sign out of my hotel room, since I don\'t want to pay for any more nights. I deliberately left the key in the room, so I\'ll fly through the crack in either the door or the window to get it.
Second, the police department might be getting suspicious that I, as this police officer, haven\'t reported over the night.

Third, I live at the Arcticon Research Facility, a large underground science complex located in the snowy mountains north on this continent. However, Arcticon\'s entrance is restricted to authorized personnel, and I won\'t be recognized as this officer, so I need another way to get in and out of there.
Well, I have my work cut out for me.
I use the phone in the officer\'s apartment to call a good coworker of mine, Dr. Caitlyn Rylie. \"Hello Caitlyn, I\'m Dr. Kaden,\" I say.
\"Dr. Kaden? You sound different,\" says Caitlyn.
\"Do you remember the chemical compound that we were all working on? Well, I finally drank a sample of it, and now I can possess other people.\"
\"Oh, Kadey, it really is you. So, you\'re in a different body then?\"

\"Yeah, that\'s right, Caitlyn. Anyway, I can\'t get back to Arcticon the way I am now. Can you pick me and drive us back?\" After giving Caitlyn my street address, she agrees. \"Also, we need to stop off at the hotel that I was staying at. Is that okay, Caitlyn?\" I ask.
\"Uh, okay, Kaden,\" she says.
Nearly an hour later, Caitlyn pulls in front of the apartment building. \"Caitlyn, over here!\" I wave.
\"Oh, hey, you really did switch bodies. And you\'re a cop? Well, all right, get in.\"
\"Actually, I need to leave this body here. I don\'t want the police department to trace any place past this officer\'s home. That means I need to possess you, Caitlyn.\"
\"Me?\" Caitlyn asks. \"Do you have to? I mean, it just seems invasive. That\'s all.\" She scratches her head.
\"Well, if I\'m not in a body, I can be in a gaseous form, but then we couldn\'t keep a low profile.\"
Caitlyn looks at a towel in the back seat. \"Wait,\" she says. \"I can wrap you in my towel, and it\'ll look like you\'re a baby in a blanket. It\'d be cute! Well, how about it?\" she asks.
\"Okay Caitlyn, you can wrap me in the towel if you want to.\"
I fly out of the officer and onto the towel. \"Thanks, Kadey,\" Caitlyn says, as she wraps me in. She drives to the hotel and goes up to my floor.
Caitlyn puts me down, in front of my door. I fly through the bottom of the door, get the key, give the keys to Caitlyn, and fly back into my blanket.
Caitlyn and I go down to the lobby. While Caitlyn is checking out with the receptionist, the receptionist notices me. \"Oh, what a cute baby. Can I see?\" she asks.

Caitlyn tries to turn me towards the receptionist, but I resist. Can Caitlyn not realize how showing my face could blow our cover? \"What\'s wrong, Kadey? Why don\'t you want to look away from my chest? Did you want to drink?\" Caitlyn asks.
\"Oh, her name\'s Katie? That\'s such a good name!\" says the receptionist. I roll my eyes.
\"Well, we have to go,\" says Caitlyn.

Once we\'re back in the car, Caitlyn comes to a realization. \"Wait, I can\'t breast-feed you anyway. You don\'t have a mouth. Also, I need to give birth to an actual baby to produce milk anyway. I\'m a doctor, so I should have known that. Oops.\" Caitlyn is right. I don\'t have a mouth in this form, although I might still be able to talk without it. I\'m about to call her out for her absent-mindedness, but I decide against it, since she is a good friend.
Caitlyn drives north on the highway to Arcticon.

We reach the snowy mountain pass, one of the highest points on this continent, and one that gives a great view. We pass through Arcticon\'s security checkpoint without incident. Caitlyn parks in the parking garage, and we take the adjoining tram, which goes to the underground research center.
Afterwards, I fly out of the baby blanket.
\"No, Caitlyn. No one will think that I\'m a baby if they actually see my face.\"
\"Okay, but you owe me if I ever need a favor later on,\" says Caitlyn.
\"Understood.\" I fly out of the officer and into Caitlyn. I drive to the hotel and go up to my floor.
I kneel in front of my door and fly out of Caitlyn, fly through the bottom of the door, get the key, and fly back into Caitlyn.
I go down to the lobby and check out with the receptionist. \"You don\'t look like a \'Mr. Kaden\',\" says the receptionist, skeptically.
\"I\'m his wife. I\'m just checking out for him,\" I reply.
\"How can I be sure about that?\" she asks.
\"Because I know more about his tastes than you do, Plain Jane,\" I smirk, tossing my key onto her desk and leaving.
I drive north on the highway to Arcticon.

I reach the snowy mountain pass, one of the highest points on this continent, and one that gives a great view. I pass through Arcticon\'s security checkpoint without incident. I park in the parking garage and take the adjoining tram, which goes to the underground research center.
Afterwards, I fly out of Caitlyn. She\'s initially dazed, but she gets better after a moment.
After that, I manage to have my clothes appear on me, just by thinking about it.
\"Come on, we need to meet Yuki,\" Caitlyn says, dragging me by the hand.
Caitlyn leads me to a lounge with Dr. Yukio Kiyoshi, another coworker of ours. \"Hello, Caitlyn … and Kaden?\" he says, surprised.
\"Yuki, you know how I said Kaden called me a couple of hours ago? Well, this is what he\'s like now. He can go inside other people and control them, like a ghost.\"
\"Amazing,\" Yukio says. \"So, what do we do now?\" asks Yukio.
\"Uh …\" Caitlyn hesitates, turning towards me. \"What do you want to do, Kadey? Whatever it is, I\'m sure Yuki and I would love to help you with it.\"
\"I haven\'t decided yet,\" I tell Caitlyn and Yukio. \"Okay Kaden, Caitlyn and I will be around here if you want to talk to us later,\" says Yukio. I nod and leave.
I take the tram to the housing sector of the Arcticon Research Facility.
Once I\'m back at my apartment, I lie on my bed, relaxed.

\"Hello. I am pleased to meet you, Dr. Kaden,\" says a voice. I turn to a man standing near my bedroom door. He\'s wearing a leather waistcoat, a tribal skirt made of cloth, and leather boots. \"I am Bek\'Shtii, god of tradition and the past. Surely, you already know about me.\"
\"Yeah, I do,\" I reply.

\"You drank from my blood and became a false spirit, which is an act of sacrilege. Normally, such acts are punished, but I will forgive you under one condition. My siblings and I want to learn more about you. Therefore, I want you to come to our home. We live in the ancient ruins of our city, and you can find it in the forest to the west.\"
\"The forest to the west? Are you talking about the Western Continental Park?\" I ask.

\"Correct, but there is a problem. The park is not open to the entire public at the moment, and flying over the park as a spirit might draw the ire of the park rangers. Stay here for today, as I will return here tomorrow to share a plan with you.\"
Bek\'Shtii finally leaves. It seems like I have the rest of the day to myself. I wonder what I should do.
I decide to visit Caitlyn.

I walk in on Caitlyn playing with Foxtrot the Ferret, one of Arcticon\'s most beloved test animals. Caitlyn waves a plush toy above Foxtrot, and Foxtrot stands up and claws at it. \"Get it, Foxy! Get it!\" says Caitlyn. Caitlyn turns and looks at me. \"Kadey, how\'ve you been?\" she asks.
\"I\'m all right, I guess.\"
\"Did I embarrass you when we pretended you were a baby?\" asks Caitlyn.
\"A little bit,\" I admit.
\"Oh, heheh. Sorry about that,\" she says, hugging me.
\"One more thing, can I ask you a personal question?\" says Caitlyn.
\"Okay,\" I reply.
\"Do you think I would be a good mother?\"
I think about it for a moment.
Yeah, probably. You\'re definitely friendly enough.\"
\"Thanks,\" Caitlyn says, blushing.
\"I\'m not sure. I\'m not much of a family person, so you might want to ask someone who is more knowledgeable about that.\"
\"Yeah, that\'s a good idea,\" Caitlyn admits.

Caitlyn adds, \"I guess I studied medicine in the first place so that I could care for other people, and if I had kids, they\'d look up to me when I took care of them. I don\'t know. Sorry. Was this a stupid question?\"
\"When we drove from the city, how did you feel when I possessed you?\" I ask.
\"Oh, I felt light-headed for a second, and then I just went to sleep. Nothing hurt or anything.\"
\"So you weren\'t conscious while I was possessing you? You can\'t remember anything during that time?\" I ask, wanting to confirm.
\"I can\'t. It felt like I was just going to sleep, and then a few moments later, I woke up. That\'s it.\"
\"I see. Thanks, Caitlyn.\"
\"No problem,\" Caitlyn responds.
\"How did you feel when you possessed me?\" she asks.
\"I really enjoyed it, actually.\"
\"I see. I never realized how close you wanted to be to me,\" Caitlyn says, blushing.
\"It felt a little bit weird, to be honest.\"
\"Yeah, it felt weird to me, too. I guess that\'s something we won\'t do again,\" Caitlyn shrugs.
\"It wasn\'t weird of me to ask that, was it?\" Caitlyn asks.
\"No. Besides, I\'m fine with talking once in a while. Thank you. Take care, Caitlyn.\"
I decide to visit Yukio.
I see Yukio working on a computer. He turns around when he hears me walk in. \"Yes, Kaden?\" he asks.
\"You didn\'t take long to go back to work. Did my breakthrough not impress you for long?\" I ask.

\"It is not that. Of course developing a compound that changes its consumer\'s form is a significant accomplishment. Kaden, you have good ideas, and sometimes, you execute them well, and I am certain that the science community values you for that. However, I want to talk about your work ethics. For example, you lied to our supervisor about the compound that you were working on actually was. Then, you managed to convince him to have Caitlyn and I help you with it. This morning, you asked Caitlyn to drive you back here. She is not your chauffeur. She is your coworker, as am I. You are not our boss. You, Caitlyn, and I are equal in rank. It is no secret that Caitlyn has a soft spot for us two, but you seem to take it for granted.\"
I fold my arms and reply to him, \"Thanks for your feedback, Yukio, but I only take charge because I\'m the smartest one here. Take care.\" I leave the room.
I decide to sleep until tomorrow.
Chapter 4
15 years ago …

I was on a field trip that day. I was with my class at the Science History Museum. Our tour guide, a retired scientist, showed many different inventions and the various breakthroughs in physics, biology, chemistry, and other sciences. Later in the tour, the guide, now visibly exhausted and sweating, showed us some chemical compounds made by one of the greatest alchemists of the early modern period. These exhibits intrigued me. \"I\'ve met a good many geniuses throughout my life. Who knows, perhaps the next great innovator is with us now,\" said the tour guide.
\"Wow, Alex is such a dweeb for actually liking this stuff,\" said one of the students, noticing my interest.
\"Come on, Bobby, leave Alex alone,\" said a girl, defending me.
\"Are you okay, Alex?\" she asked.
\"Yeah, I\'m fine. Thanks, though. Wait … you look familiar.\"
The girl laughed, comfortingly, \"I\'m Rebecca, Rebecca Davis. You know, I am in the same apartment building as you, just one floor down.\"
\"Oh, yeah, I remember now. I guess I\'m not that good with remembering people. Heheh,\" I laughed, awkwardly. \"Thanks again … Rebecca.\"
Chapter 5

\"Wake up,\" says Bek\'Shtii. I\'m groggy, but I eventually come to my senses. \"I have a plan for you to reach our home. In two days, students from St. Josephine\'s Secondary School will go on a field trip to the Western Continental Park. You need to go to that school, possess a student there, and get on that field trip.\"
\"That sounds like a roundabout way to get to your ancient city. Is it really so bad for me to go straight there like this?\"

\"Yes, if the park rangers see you, they might capture you on surveillance video. If you appear on video, then the modern world will have proof that spirits, even false spirits like you, still exist. If that happens, even more people will try to seize power from us. It is bad enough that you already have done so.\"

Bek\'Shtii points to the vent on my wall. \"Use the ventilation system to leave your underground complex and go south to the suburban district of New Ferando. Stay behind the tree line as you follow the highway. As a false spirit, you can run quickly without exhaustion. You have little more than an hour before sunrise. Go, now.\" I nod and fly through my vent.
After a minute of navigating upwards through the Arcticon vent system, I reach the surface. I have my clothes reappear on me, just like last time, and run alongside the quiet, nearly-empty highway.

I eventually reach St. Josephine\'s Secondary School. It\'s not daylight just yet, but I see a building on the campus that is most likely a dormitory. I see a window that is slightly open, so I fly up through it.
I see two single beds, both of which had people sleeping in them. It was too dark to see who they were, so I take my chances and jump into one of them.

I must have fallen asleep for at least an hour, since when I regain consciousness, the sun is shining brightly outside. \"Ellie, Ellie! Wake up! We need to go to class,\" says a girl from the other bed. Some of my hair is covering my eyes, so I brush it aside. I get out of bed and walk to a nearby mirror.

In the mirror, I see that I\'m a young, adolescent girl. This would be a good time to know more about my host. I concentrate and am able to access basic parts of my host\'s memory. I can\'t get any specific memories, really, just enough general information for me to understand who I am. It seems that I am now Élodie Noël, or \"Ellie\" for short. I was born to a father from the mainland and a mother from the eastern continent. I am currently in eighth grade at St. Josephine\'s Secondary School, which is a non-state boarding school that serves grades 6-12.

\"Don\'t take too long getting dressed,\" smiles the other girl in the room. That girl is Carleigh Lexington, apparently a good friend of mine. Carleigh has a brother, Hewitt, who also attends St. Josephine\'s.
\"Right,\" I nod at Carleigh.

I change out of my pajamas into my school uniform. It takes a few minutes to put on everything. When I\'m done, I see myself in a dress shirt with a blazer and a necktie. I\'m also wearing a tartan skirt, medium-length socks, and color-matching shoes. I have to admit, I actually like this look, but … what situation have I put myself in? Back when I startled that police officer when I first got my ability, I was intimidating, I was powerful. Now, who am I? Some schoolgirl? Eh, this feels like a downgrade. At least, like this, I\'ll have an easy time staying beneath suspicion.

Carleigh and I have the same first class: literature; so we go to the classroom together. In class, the instructor greets us, saying \"Good morning, class! Today, I have a short story to share with you, called \'Paul and the Troubles of Peer Pressure\'. Everyone, get into your reading groups, and I\'ll pass out the story. Read it with your group, share your thoughts, and fill out the questionnaire that I have right here, when you\'re done.\"

I get into a group consisting of Carleigh and a couple of her friends. The story is about a boy, named \"Paul\", who succumbs to peer pressure and tries to imitate and fit in with the popular students at his school. Near the end, the wise adults tell him to be himself, since trying to be like another person wouldn\'t make him happy. Basically, the story tells its message in the most heavy-handed way possible. After our group reads the story, we discuss its meaning.
Carleigh reads aloud the questionnaire that the instructor had handed out. \"First question: \'Why did Paul want to fit in with his peers?\'\"
\"Because of bad writing?\" asks Carleigh\'s friend.
\"Sure, but let\'s put something that the teacher wants to read.\"
\"Okay, because … Paul didn\'t feel like he had anything unique about him?\"
\"Sure, I\'ll write that.\"
\"Second question: \'On a scale from one to ten, how justified were Paul\'s actions?\' I\'ll answer this one. Three.\"

Ugh, this class activity is terrible. I never felt peer pressure as my old self, even when I was younger. I never understood this issue. Carleigh continues, \"Final question: \'What is the number one reason why you should be yourself?\' Ellie, do you want to answer this one?\"
\"Sure,\" I say.
\"The number one reason why you should be yourself is …\n\n… that you can\'t play to your strengths if you lower yourself to someone else\'s level.\"
\"Yeah, you can\'t associate with those lowly people,\" says Carleigh jokingly.
\"The number one reason why you should be yourself is …\n\n… that it\'s how you keep your self-confidence and stay happy.\"
\"You have a point, but we all have been teased for being ourselves,\" sighs Carleigh.

\"The number one reason why you should be yourself is …\n\n… that you might follow someone stupid. If you know your role model isn\'t stupid, then it\'s okay to not be yourself, because the role model is obviously doing something right.\"
\"Being pragmatic, eh? Interesting answer,\" says Carleigh.
\"Done,\" says Carleigh. Phew, finally. I ask my groupmates if they thought that this activity was terrible too.
\"Yeah, whoever wrote this thinks kids like us are dumb, like we can\'t think for ourselves,\" replies Carleigh\'s friend.
Class finally ends, and I go through the halls to my second class. On my way, I pass by an older girl in a cheerleading uniform.
The girl looks at me and trips me. \"Why don\'t you go back to your own country, dweeb?\" she laughs. Ugh, I don\'t have time to deal with her now, so I move on.

A few more hours pass until lunch break. I head to the cafeteria and buy lunch. I find Carleigh and Hewitt at a table, and I sit and eat with them. Hewitt looks at me, \"One of my sister\'s friends said that she saw a cheerleader be mean to you. If that happens, don\'t worry about it; those people are just jealous, and they don\'t deserve your attention.\"
\"You\'re right, they are just jealous,\" I say, agreeing with Hewitt.
\"Oh, Ellie,\" adds Carleigh, \"can you help me study with a math test?\"

I know I\'ve technically never met Carleigh until today, but it feels like I\'ve known her for a long time. I can\'t let her down. I have to help her. \"Yeah, I can help you with math,\" I say. We finish our lunch, and Carleigh and I go to the school library.

Carleigh opens her math textbook and shows it to me. The math looks familiar to me. As a scientist, I use math on a somewhat regular basis. The only difference is that, in the professional field, I do mathematics with a computer. Here in school, I\'ll have to do that math by hand. Hopefully, my written math skills haven\'t faded away yet. \"Are you ready to help?\" whispers Carleigh.
\"Yes,\" I whisper back. What Carleigh doesn\'t realize is that my help is going to be more … direct than she expects. I look around to see if anyone else in the library is looking at us.
When it\'s safe, I jump into Carleigh, possessing her.

I look down at myself to see if the possession worked. Everything looks fine. I look over at Élodie. She looks a bit dazed, and I assume that she wasn\'t conscious while I was possessing her. \"Hey … Ellie, we\'re in the library. Let\'s go outside,\" I whisper.
\"What?\" Élodie yawns. I let Élodie lean on my shoulder, and I walk her out of the library.
\"Why are we here?\" asks Élodie.
\"It\'s noontime. You and I were working hard in class earlier. If you don\'t remember anything, then it\'s probably from all of the exhaustion,\" I lie to her.
\"Okay, Carleigh. I\'m dizzy. I need to sit down. Maybe we can talk after classes. I\'m sorry.\"
The bell rings. I brush my hair back, straighten my necktie and blazer, and head to my math class.

Once class starts, the math instructor passes out the test and asks the class to be quiet. I read over the test and then write \"my\" name at the top of the paper. \"Carleigh Lexington\", I think that I spelt that right. Now, onto the test.

Question 1: \"Farmer McBilly has 40 m of fence that he can use to enclose his livestock. McBilly wants to give his animals the most room to move around in. McBilly hires an Honors Math student from the local school to lay out his enclosure. What is the largest size that McBilly\'s enclosure can be?\"
The largest size from 40 m of fence is …\n\n… 10 m × 10 m.
The largest size from 40 m of fence is …\n\n… 6 m × 14 m.

Question 4: \"Four doctoral graduates celebrate by eating dinner at a restaurant. The table that they are seated at had four chairs, but the graduates cannot decide who will sit where. How many possible ways can the graduates sit at the table?\"
The number of combinations of seating for 4 people is …\n\n… 16.
The number of combinations of seating for 4 people is …\n\n… 24.

Question 9: \"A boy is making a necklace for his girlfriend. He wants to put a gem lookalike inside the necklace\'s pendant. He pours silica into a gemstone-shaped mold and burns it, turning the silica into glass. The boy plans to stain the glass with the color of his girlfriend\'s birthstone. Before the boy colors the glass, he must cut it into a right triangle to fit it inside the pendant. If one side of the fake gem is 9 mm and the other is 12 mm, then how long is the fake gem\'s hypotenuse?\"
A right triangle with sides of 9 mm and 12 mm has a hypotenuse of …\n\n… 10.5 mm.
A right triangle with sides of 9 mm and 12 mm has a hypotenuse of …\n\n… 15 mm.

After finishing all of the questions, I turn in my paper. At the end of class, the instructor says, \"There won\'t be any class tomorrow, but you can still come to pick up your graded tests. Have a good field trip, everyone!\"

On my way to my next class, I pass the cheerleader who tripped me when I was Élodie. She doesn\'t notice me, but I do see her entering the gym. She probably has physical education next class period. This is a good time for revenge.
I go into the locker room and look for a girl who is about the same age as that cheerleader. I find a taller girl changing out of her normal school uniform, in an aisle of lockers, all by herself.
I walk up to the girl and possess her.

I am now Ananya Sanjeet. I am in eleventh grade, and I am a member of my school\'s track and field club. I finish taking off my current uniform and put on the T-shirt and athletic shorts that were in my locker. After doing so, some of my hair falls in front of my face. I also notice that I have a hair tie on my wrist.

Since I don\'t want to constantly adjust my hair during physical education, I use the tie to tie my hair in a ponytail. I look in the mirror in my locker, and it seems that I did a fairly decent job. I lock my locker and head to the gym.
When gym class begins, we line up for attendance. I see the cheerleader in the line across from mine. I narrow my eyes and smirk.

After attendance, the coach begins his lecture, \"You are all bright young men and women, and you have the rest of your lives ahead of you. Today, I am going to teach you some basic self-defense so that you can keep that life safe. As many of you know, almost all of the industrialized world bans civilians from possessing firearms, including our country. It\'s been like this for over a decade, and it has been keeping us safe. Now, some rural areas are exempt from the firearms ban, but we won\'t be focusing on those today. Anyway, the problem is that criminals have an obvious tendency of not playing by the rules. It is possible, even if not likely, that, one day, one of them will use a gun to threaten you. Can anyone tell me what they would do if a criminal threatened them with a gun?\"
I have a good answer to this question. I raise my hand, and the coach calls on me, \"Yes, Ananya?\"
\"I would just listen to what the criminal says.\"

\"Ananya probably did the smartest thing,\" the coach says. \"When staying alive is your priority, you don\'t necessarily need to be a hero. Compliance might seem cowardly to some of you, but it\'s really not. Even if the criminal decides to rob you, for example, losing whatever cash you had on hand is a small price to pay for saving your life, and the police might be able help you once you\'re safe and are able to contact them.\"
\"I would run away.\"

\"So Ananya decided to run away before the criminal could hurt her,\" the coach says. \"It really depends on where you are, but this is generally one of the worse options. In an open area, running away can immediately be a costly mistake. Even in an area with more cover, the criminal can react to you fleeing and shoot you in a matter of seconds. Remember, guns are ranged weapons.\"
The coach disagrees with me, but even still, he\'s not in a position to give advice on that type of self-defense.
\"I would twist the gun out of his hand and attack him.\"

\"So Ananya decided to be bold and overpower our bad guy,\" the coach says. \"If, and only if, you are sure that you are stronger than the criminal, then disarming him becomes a possible option. If you succeed, then you can gain control of the situation. However, more often than not, victims who attempt this fail. In fact, last year, two out of every five gun-related deaths here in the western continent were due to over-confidence of the victim. Be careful.\"

\"Thank you, Ananya. Okay, class, we\'re going to practice defensive martial arts. Everyone, take the mats that are rolled up on the wall over there and lay them across the gym floor.\" We all lay out the mats as instructed and we take off our shoes. \"All right, now find a partner and practice what we did last time.\"

Without hesitation, I walk up to the cheerleader and ask her if she wants to spar with me. At first, she looks at me weirdly. \"Uh … okay, I guess,\" she shrugs. We start off by exchanging some light punches between each other.
My spar with the cheerleader gets more intense as we both concentrate. Eventually, the cheerleader tries to hook me, but she\'s too slow. I dodge to her side, grab her shoulder, and …
… I carefully pin the cheerleader to the floor mat.
\"Nice counter, Ananya!\" says the coach. I help the cheerleader up, but she sneers at me.
… I kick the cheerleader in the leg.
I hear the cheerleader\'s blood vessels crack. \"Ow!\" yells the cheerleader, dropping to the mat.
I run to the coach and say, \"Coach! My partner is hurt. Can you take a look?\" The coach follows me to the cheerleader.
\"What happened?\" he asks.
\"This Ananya dweeb kicked me! Now my calf is going to be all bruised!\" she whines.
\"It was an accident. I\'m so sorry,\" I say, feigning concern. The coach helps her stand up. \"I hope you get better,\" I lie to her.
\"Ananya, be more careful next time,\" says the coach.
\"Okay, I will,\" I nod.
A few minutes later, the coach instructs us to go back to our locker rooms and change before the bell rings so that we can get to our next classes on time.
Instead of going to the locker room, however, I jog over to the dormitories, stand under the window of Élodie\'s room, and jump out of Ananya and fly through the window.
No one\'s here yet. I hide in the closet for a couple of hours. Eventually, Élodie comes into the bedroom and lies on the bed.
I should probably possess Élodie now, before Carleigh comes back too, so I do.
After possessing Élodie, I stay lying on the bed for a bit longer.

Carleigh still isn\'t back yet. I might as well call Caitlyn and Yukio and let them know what I\'ve been doing. After all, they\'re probably already worried that I\'m not at the Arcticon Research Facility. If I call them when Carleigh comes back, it\'ll be awkward if she overhears me. Otherwise, if I don\'t call them at all today, then Caitlyn and Yukio will just get more worried.
\"Hello, Caitlyn. It\'s me, Dr. Kaden, again.\"
\"Kadey? Where are you? Who are you? Are you okay?\"

\"Yeah, I\'m fine. I\'m … uh …\" Oh, this is a problem. I\'m not sure if I should tell Caitlyn about the native gods who were talking to me. \"I left Arcticon to get some fresh air. Some people were nearby, and they were about to see me, so I possessed the nearest person whom I could find, and I ended up becoming an adolescent girl. I can\'t come back until … it\'s safe and no one can see me. Maybe a couple of days.\"
\"Oh, I\'m sorry to hear you\'re stuck like that. Do you want me to drive you back here now, Kadey? We can pretend that you\'re my daughter. I\'d be fine with that.\"
\"There\'s no need, Caitlyn. I just realized that I can fly through Arcticon\'s ventilation system to enter and leave as I please.\"
\"Okay.\"
\"Wait, Kadey,\" Caitlyn says, \"Yuki is right here with me. He wants to talk to you.\"
\"Hello? Kaden?\" asks Yukio.
\"Hello,\" I reply.
\"I do not believe that \'getting fresh air\' is a sufficient excuse to not come to work.\"
I groan. \"Listen, Yukio,\" I say, \"if it makes you feel better, then I\'ll call our supervisor and say that I\'m on a field study.\"

\"Do so. Also, Kaden, you might not believe me, but I wanted to work well with you, just like Caitlyn does. However, you have shown apathy towards other people, and continuing to be apathetic will hurt you.\"

\"Okay, fine, Yukio. I\'ve wanted to complete this project for years, and I\'ve only just completed it two days ago. If I haven\'t been focusing on the needs of other people recently, then I\'m sorry. That\'s just how it is.\"
\"Goodbye, Kaden,\" sighs Yukio.

I go back to lying on my bed. Yukio said that I don\'t care about other people, but that\'s not true. I mean, I helped Carleigh earlier with math. Yeah, I\'m not a selfless caregiver or anything, but still, what does Yukio do that makes him think that\'s he\'s better than me?
Eh, I\'ve gone on long enough.
Carleigh eventually comes back. \"Hey Ellie,\" she says.
\"Hey Carleigh,\" I say. \"How did your math test go?\"

\"This might sound weird,\" she says, \"but I\'m actually not sure. I barely even remember being in math class. Around when you were helping me, things seemed to go by like a blur. I was even about to go to PE class at the wrong time. It sounds silly. I know.\"
\"Well, I hope that I was able to turn you into St. Josephine\'s new star student,\" I laugh.
\"Shut up, Ellie,\" Carleigh laughs back, embarrassed. \"Anyway, I have to admit, you can be pretty cool sometimes.\"
\"Only sometimes, huh?\" I ask, smiling. \"Okay, well … I\'ll still take it as a compliment.\" We both keep laughing.
Later, in the evening, my phone rings. \"Hello? Ellie? It\'s Hewitt.\"
\"Hey, Hewitt,\" I reply.
\"Thanks for helping my sister today. You\'ve always been a great friend to both of us. Hey, since tomorrow\'s the last day before the field trip, do you think you can hang out with me after class?\"

Well, this caught me off guard. I\'m supposed to be meeting those gods, not to go on some playdate. On the other hand, I don\'t want to let Hewitt down. \"Maybe, Hewitt,\" I say. \"I\'ll let you know my decision tomorrow at lunch.\"
It gets late, and we decide to go to sleep.
Chapter 6
11 years ago …

I was on a week-long break from school. That evening, Rebecca and I went out to eat dinner together. We walked to the main city square. The weather was cool. The signs on the surrounding buildings were so colorful and brightly lit that it contrasted so well with the dark sky.
Rebecca even took a photograph of us standing in front of Main Avenue.
We got hungry. \"Hey Alex,\" Rebecca smiled, holding my hand. \"How about that restaurant?\' she asked, pointing with her other hand. I agreed, and we went in there.

We were seated at a booth. I ordered a toasted ham sandwich, and Rebecca ordered a lean chicken salad. Both of our meals were seasoned with the west\'s signature herbs. Everything was just about perfect. \"Have any plans for the rest of our break?\" Rebecca asked.
\"Nah, I\'ll just be using my computer.\"

\"Okay, well, I\'ll be with my other friends, and I\'ll be sure to tell them all about this. Speaking of computers, though, I\'ll probably post our picture online to my friends. I can send it to you, too, if you want.\"

We finished our meals. I thanked Rebecca for going out with me and gave her a quick kiss. She hesitated. \"Okay, lover boy,\" she joked, \"we should go home before it gets even darker,\" and so we left.
Chapter 7
\"Good morning, again, Sleepy Head!\"
\"Oh, it\'s you again?\" I snore.
\"Wait, you\'re in Carleigh! Were you her the whole time?\" I ask Carleigh, who is obviously possessed by Sezja.
\"Maybe, maybe not,\" Sezja-as-Carleigh says, with her finger on her chin … with his finger on his chin … with Sezja placing Carleigh\'s finger on Carleigh\'s chin. You get the idea.

I stare in shock at Sezja. \"Ooh! You should see the look on your face! It\'s so cute!\" he says. \"Seriously though, I just possessed this girl this morning,\" he admits. \"Oh, but this is so great! We can be best friends forever, like I\'ve always dreamt of!\"
Sezja runs towards me and hugs me, squeezing my chest in the process. Seriously, he\'s squeezing my chest. I think he\'s doing it on purpose, too.
\"So, why are you here?\" I ask.

\"Oh, my brother asked me to visit you to see if you were adjusting well. You\'re obviously just fine. I\'m supposed to be heading back now, but … I think I\'ll stay with you, for fun!\" Sezja-as-Carleigh enthuses.
\"Can you at least act normal if you\'re going to be Carleigh?\" I ask. Sezja shrugs.
In literature class, I get back into my group from yesterday. The instructor passes back the group paper that the real Carleigh and her friends wrote with me.
\"Aw, we lost two-thirds credit on the last problem,\" Carleigh\'s friend says. \"The teacher didn\'t like how we said \'lower ourselves to someone else\'s level\'.\"
\"Ugh, this teacher is such a drag anyway,\" says Carleigh\'s other friend.
\"Hey, we got full credit. Nice!\" Carleigh\'s friend says. \"I guess the teacher bought the \'be happy\' crap that we wrote for the last problem.\"
\"Good job, girls,\" says Carleigh\'s other friend.
\"Aw, we lost two-thirds credit on the last problem,\" Carleigh\'s friend says. \"The teacher didn\'t like how we said \'it\'s okay to not be yourself\'.\"
Sezja doesn\'t speak much as Carleigh, though that\'s probably for the best.
The rest of my classes before lunch go fine. I don\'t share any of those classes with Carleigh, so I\'m just hoping that Sezja isn\'t ruining Carleigh\'s image.

Finally, it\'s lunchtime. I promised Hewitt that I would tell him whether I wanted to go out with him. I go to the dining area and see Hewitt eating some chicken strips. I sit in front of him. \"Hello, Hewitt.\" Hewitt looks up at me. \"I\'ve thought about when you asked me to hang out with you later this afternoon. My answer is …\"
\"… yes. I\'d be fine with hanging out.\"
\"… no. I\'m sorry, Hewitt, but I\'m busy today.\"
\"Yeah, whatever, Babe,\" burps Hewitt, with food still in his mouth. Gross! \"Now buy me some dessert. This chicken isn\'t filling me up,\" he demands.
\"Ugh, you\'re such a jerk,\" I remark.
I stand up and walk away. I don\'t get it. Hewitt seemed all right yesterday. Today, he seems like a completely different person … oh no.
I pass by the dormitories on my walk. \"Psst! Dr. Kaden, I have wanted to meet you,\" says a voice.

I turn to my side and see a woman standing behind the dormitory building. I walk towards her. Upon closer inspection, I notice that she is leafy and green and is wearing tribal clothing. Before either of us is able to talk, I hear Hewitt shouting behind me, \"Hey Babe, I said get me a dessert! Why are you taking your sweet time?\"
Hewitt runs up to me, but then notices the woman next to me. \"Sister?\" says Hewitt, puzzled.
\"Brother, that boy does not deserve a slob, like you, to possess him.\"
\"You were watching me, Sister? How dare you follow me around!\" snaps Hewitt.
\"Hey, you\'re only here because you must have been following me around,\" I say to Hewitt, interjecting.
\"No one was talking to you, Princess!\" says Hewitt, grabbing me by the shirt.
\"Stop!\" yells the woman. She reaches out to Hewitt, and her hands go inside of him. When that happens, Hewitt lets go of me and shrieks in pain.

Eventually, the woman pulls something out of Hewitt. It\'s a man! A large, heavy man is being pulled out of Hewitt. The man is wearing no clothing, except for a grass skirt. Eventually, the woman completely separates the man from Hewitt\'s body. Hewitt himself then collapses to the ground.
\"Let you be cursed, Sister! I\'m going home!\" yells the man, as he runs out of sight.

\"I am sorry that you witnessed that,\" says the woman. \"My brother lacks discipline. In addition, my brother\'s yelling may have attracted attention. I do not want others to see me like this. Dr. Kaden, would you be all right with switching into that boy over there?\" she asks, pointing at Hewitt.
\"Sure,\" I nod.

As I possess Hewitt, I notice the woman dissolving into a black vapor. After I\'ve fully possessed Hewitt, the woman absorbs herself into Élodie. After that, Élodie blinks, feels for her own face, and looks down at herself. \"Ah yes, this is good,\" says Élodie. \"Please, Dr. Kaden, let us eat lunch together before the period ends,\" she says. She grabs my hand and takes me to the cafeteria.
At the cafeteria, I order a ham sandwich. Élodie orders a ham sandwich as well. \"This lunch will be my treat, Dr. Kaden,\" she says, offering to pay.
We eat at a table. Our sandwiches are cold, but I wasn\'t expecting much from a school cafeteria anyway. \"So, I take it that you and your brother are more of these gods that I keep meeting,\" I say.
\"Yes, Dr. Kaden. I am Va\'Nal, the goddess of romance. My brother whom you just met is Baqer. All of us gods love each other, even though Baqer can be a handful.\"
\"I see, but haven\'t I met all of you now? Why do I need to go to your ancient city if you\'re all just going to stop by and say \'hi\' to me anyway?\"
\"Dr. Kaden, it will make sense when the time comes.\"

I see Carleigh coming towards us. \"Hello again, Best Friend,\" Carleigh says to Va\'Nal-as-Élodie. It seems that Sezja is still possessing Carleigh, but doesn\'t realize that I\'m Hewitt now and that Élodie is actually Va\'Nal. Sezja-as-Carleigh sits next to Va\'Nal-as-Élodie and smiles at her.
\"I have never heard you call me \'Best Friend\', brother,\" says Va\'Nal.
\"Oh! Sister! Is that you? I\'m so sorry,\" says a shocked Sezja.
\"It is all right,\" says Va\'Nal. \"Your friend is over there,\" she says, pointing at me.
\"Hello again, best friend,\" Sezja says, now looking towards me.
\"Hello,\" I say back. \"Sezja, can you remember to get Carleigh\'s math paper?\"
\"Uh … sure. Why are you asking?\" Sezja asks.
\"I helped Carleigh with her math test. Well, really, I just took the test for her,\" I say.

\"Hey, hey, that was sweet of you. You really are a most bestest friend!\" Sezja says. \"You seem excited to get your grade back, Best Friend. You can come with me to math class. You can even do the talking. I get nervous talking to most mortals, anyway.\"

The bell rings as Sezja and I enter the room for Carleigh\'s math class. We approach the instructor. \"Hi, I\'m here to get the test back for my sister, Carleigh Lexington.\" The instructor looks through all of the students\' papers and hands me mine, well, Carleigh\'s. \"Thanks,\" I say, and Sezja and I leave the room.
My score is 10/10. That\'s perfect! The real Carleigh will love this when she finds out.
My score is 9/10. That\'s great! The real Carleigh will love this when she finds out.
My score is 8/10. That\'s good. I wonder how the real Carleigh will feel when she finds out.
My score is 7/10. I answered all of the difficult questions incorrectly. I hope that I don\'t let down the real Carleigh too much when she finds out.
Time passes as I attend the rest of Hewitt\'s classes. I do overhear some students talk about the upcoming field trip from time to time, but otherwise, nothing too special happens.
By the evening, I\'ve come to my new dormitory and am now lying on my bed. I hear my bedroom door being opened. I look over and see Élodie entering the room, her blazer now off. \"Va\'Nal?\" I ask.
\"Yes, it is still I,\" she responds.
\"How did you come into the boys\' dormitories?\" I ask.
\"A goddess knows her way around,\" she smiles. \"Look at yourself, Dr. Kaden. You are a boy lying on his bed, all alone. It has been years for you, and yet little has changed.\"
\"What do you mean?\" I ask.

\"You seek companionship. Do you not, Dr. Kaden? I can see into your heart. You think of older days. You think of … her. It is not healthy. No matter whose body you are in, your heart remains the same. You need to stop thinking of her before it is too late. I can help.\"
She strokes my forehead. \"For both of our happiness … kiss me.\"
\"I can\'t kiss you, Va\'Nal.\"
\"What is wrong?\" Va\'Nal asks.
\"If I wanted a girlfriend, then I would find someone my own age, with my own body,\" I remind her.
\"But you are Hewitt now, and I am Élodie. We can be together,\" Va\'Nal says.
\"I am not interested. I\'m sorry, but I\'m just not. Please, I\'d like to be alone for the rest of the night,\" I say, nodding towards the door.
Va\'Nal looks sad. \"You are right. We would have been disrespecting our hosts anyway,\" she admits.
\"Only if you\'re sure that kissing will help me.\"
\"Of course. The heart is like any other part of the body. It needs to be cared for. I want you to stay well.\"
\"Okay,\" I nod.
Va\'Nal leans towards me and kisses. Afterwards, Va\'Nal asks, \"Well, \'Hewey\', how do you feel?\"
\"I feel better. Thank you, Va\'Nal,\" I smile. She smiles back.
\"Before I leave, I want you to know that we will be at our home, expecting you to meet us. Your classmates will be their normal selves, so be careful about what you tell them,\" Va\'Nal says.
\"Understood,\" I say, and Va\'Nal walks out the door.
I change into my pajamas and go to sleep.
Chapter 8
10 years ago …

I had to write a book report by next week. I could have written it by myself, but let\'s face it; I was never good with writing papers. It was lunchtime. I walked around the campus, looking for familiar students from my literature class.
I saw Sarah Parson sitting by herself, writing in a journal. I walk up to her. \"Hey, Sarah …\" I said.
Sarah looked up at me. \"Did you need something?\" she coldly asked.
\"You know me, right? I\'m Alexander Kaden, from literature class,\" I said.
\"Okay, and …?\" she asked.

\"Well, you know how our book report is due next week, right? I know that you\'re really good with reading and writing. I was wondering if we could meet up after class sometime this week and talk about the book. Would that be okay? I could keep you company,\" I smiled.
\"Alex,\" she said, \"I don\'t know you that well. Asking me to help is too much.\"
\"Oh, okay,\" I responded. \"I asked Rebecca earlier to help me, but she said that she couldn\'t, because she wasn\'t reading the same book in her literature class.\"
\"You know Rebecca?\" Sarah asked.
\"Yeah, we\'ve been going out together for a long time now,\" I said.
\"Oh,\" Sarah said, worried. \"Listen, Alex, I\'ll help you, but only this one time.\"
\"Thanks.\"
I looked at her journal again. \"You really like to write in that. Are you planning to study anything writing-related in university?\" I asked.
\"I\'m going to study journalism, actually,\" Sarah said.
\"Sounds cool. Good luck with that,\" I said.
\"Thank you,\" Sarah faintly smiled.
Chapter 9

Today\'s the field trip. I change out of my pajamas into a casual, camping outfit, since I don\'t need to wear my school uniform for this. Besides, this outfit will be a better job of keeping me mobile.

I head out of the dormitories to the bus stop in front of the school. Everyone from the school\'s sixth, seventh, and eighth grades is here. It\'s a huge mass of students. I do eventually find Carleigh and Élodie. \"I\'m glad that you made it out here in time. I\'d hate to tell Mom that you slept while the buses left,\" laughs Carleigh.
\"You\'d probably like it if I had slept, wouldn\'t you, Sis?\" I respond.
Carleigh shakes her head, \"No, of course not. If you did, then Ellie would just spend the whole trip talking about how you weren\'t here.\" Élodie shyly nods.

Several large buses stop by the campus to pick us up. Our names are checked off on a list as we enter the buses, one by one. The whole process of everyone boarding the buses takes nearly half an hour, but then, there are a lot of students, so it\'s reasonable to take that long.

Eventually, our bus drives away from St. Josephine and towards New Ferando\'s highway. Carleigh, Élodie, and I are all sitting together, and we talk during the bus ride. \"Hey Ellie, did I ever tell you about my math test?\" Carleigh asks.
\"I scored 10/10. That\'ll really boost my grade! Maybe I\'ll be the new star student, after all. Thanks, Ellie.\"
\"I scored 9/10. That\'ll really boost my grade! Thanks, Ellie.\"
\"I scored 8/10. I think that\'s pretty good. Thanks, Ellie.\"
\"I only scored 7/10. It\'s mainly my fault though. I spaced out a bit while you were helping me. I guess I can do that when I\'m nervous. Still, thanks, Ellie.\"
\"Oh,\" Élodie says, a bit confused.
The bus takes an exit on the highway. \"We\'re almost there,\" says a school staffer. We drive on a road surrounded by trees.

Up ahead is a secured checkpoint with park rangers. The bus stops at the checkpoint, and the staffer briefly gets out and talks to the gatekeeper. The staffer comes back onto the bus, and we continue driving.
We finally reach a lodge. The bus stops and drops us off here. It takes another 10 minutes for the rest of the buses and students to finally arrive.

Once everyone\'s here, an adult with a megaphone, presumably our field trip guide, stands in front of the large group. He says, \"Greetings, St. Josephine\'s Secondary School. This is the Western Continental Park, home to a few endangered species, as well as to the ruined ancient settlements of the native people. This building next to me is the main guest lodge. The lodge has common areas that you are all welcome to use during free time. There are also bedrooms upstairs, but there are only enough bedrooms for the grownups. Sorry kids, but you\'ll have to sleep in tents. The park staff will be setting up your tents throughout the day. I\'ll talk more about that in the evening. For now, you kids have an hour while we get everything set up. Now would be a good time to have a snack and take care of any personal business. We\'re going to be doing a lot of walking, so be prepared.\"

There is so much buildup here, and for what? I just need an opportunity to get into the ancient city ruins. Once I get there, I meet up with the native gods, do whatever they want me to do, and then I ditch this place.
I enter the lodge and go to its living room. There\'s a television set tuned to the news channel. I decide to watch.
Sarah Parson is on the screen. She\'s sitting in the network\'s interview room. \"So, what happened? From the beginning?\" Sarah asks the off-screen interviewee.

The screen cuts to the interviewee. \"I was on my regular patrol,\" says the interviewed man. \"I was walking on the sidewalk, passing by several alleys, when I heard a man coughing violently. I looked into the next alley, and I saw the man. He was wearing a blue hooded raincoat and was kneeling down on the ground. I asked him if he was all right. He looked up at me. I couldn\'t see his face. Everything inside his hood was black. Then, two red, glowing eyes showed up, where his face should\'ve been. After that, he jumped at me and knocked me unconscious. The only thing I could remember after that was me waking up just outside my apartment building.\"

The screen fades to a sketch of me in my spirit form, with red eyes and everything. The sketch is accompanied by Sarah\'s voiceover, telling viewers that if they have any information regarding me, that they should call the New Ferando Police Department.

The screen then fades to Sarah, this time sitting at a desk on the main news set. \"That interview was recorded earlier today. We\'ll have more this evening. Until then, you\'ve been watching New Ferando Network News on KNFN. Thanks for tuning in.\"
Well, this isn\'t good. Now the whole public knows about me.
Free time is over, and we\'re separated into groups, each lead by a tour guide. We embark on a long nature walk all over the park.
We pass by poison ivy. \"That\'s poison ivy over there, kids. Don\'t touch,\" the guide says.

On our walk, we see polecats climbing nearby trees. \"See those critters in the trees?\" the tour guide asks. \"Those are polecats. They originate from the mainland. Several centuries ago, some explorers from the mainland brought polecats into this continent. We\'ve been keeping the migrated polecats safe here in the park. Nowadays, most polecats have been domesticated into ferrets, and ferrets have become popular household pets.\"

Later on in the walk, we see snakes slithering on the ground. \"Careful, kids. Some snakes are venomous. You kids know how to tell whether they\'re venomous, right? My old co-worker Billy told me this saying: \'black and yellow, friendly fellow; red and black, get back\'.\" I\'m not a snake expert, but our tour guide might have gotten that mnemonic wrong. It\'s okay, though. He\'s only endangering a dozen students.

We finally pass by a view of the ancient native city, from the side of a hill. \"See that ruined city in the distance?\" the guide asks. \"That was the capital of the western continent\'s indigenous people. We won\'t be entering the city. In fact, we prefer to leave the city\'s architecture undisturbed, so we generally only allow entry during research expeditions.\" Well, that means that this is as far as I\'m going to get as a normal person.
Hm, should I run for it? I doubt that I can do it without getting noticed, but I might as well make the most out of this opportunity.
I move to the back of the group. When the guide is looking away from the students, I quietly run behind a nearby tree. I dispossess Hewitt and fly through the trees towards the city.

\"Woah, stand back, kids!\" says the tour guide, surprised. \"That looked like a black bear. Generally, those bears stay away from us humans, especially adult bears. That bear might have been an adolescent, though, so it might not have learned how dangerous humans are yet. Also, did you know that, unlike polecats, black bears are native to the western continent? It\'s true!\"

I finally reach the ancient city. It\'s filled with unoccupied stone buildings. I see the largest building in the city. It\'s a giant step pyramid, also made out of stone. I fly up the main stairs of the pyramid. At the top is a ritual room … with the four gods lounging around inside.

\"Hello, False Spirit. My brother called you that, right?\" asks Baqer. \"You were also that girl from school, weren\'t you? The one who was too lazy to get me dessert. Ah, it\'s typical of your kind. You take, you take, you take. You take our dignity. You take our blood. And what do you give in return? Nothing.\"
\"Now, now, Brother,\" says Bek\'Shtii, \"Dr. Kaden may be a false spirit, but he can still be our ally if he redeems himself.\"
\"Nuh-uh, this Kaden guy is a perfect example of why his kind isn\'t to be trusted!\" Baqer shouts back.
Bek\'Shtii and Baqer yell at each other. Sezja gets upset. \"Why do you brothers have to argue? This is supposed to be our happy place,\" Sezja cries.

Amidst all of this, Va\'Nal walks towards me. \"I am sorry that you have to see this. Our family is not so different than a mortal family, is it?\" she says, holding my shoulder, trying to comfort me.
\"I had hoped that what you and I did yesterday evening would put you in a good mood, but it seems that Baqer just has to ruin it,\" Va\'Nal says, frowning.

\"I am sorry if Baqer is making you uncomfortable. He does not know how to act appropriately amongst mortals. I suppose that I do not know how to act appropriately either, considering how I behaved towards you yesterday evening,\" Va\'Nal says, frowning.
\"Okay, okay, here is the plan now,\" Bek\'Shtii says. \"Dr. Kaden, you appeared on television earlier today, did you not?\"
\"Yes,\" I admit.
\"Wait, how did you know that?\" I ask.
\"Do not overthink,\" says Bek\'Shtii. \"Nevertheless, if that is the case, then I shall expand your powers, to increase survivability. I only ask that you stay still while I recite a chant.\"
Bek\'Shtii then chants in a language with which I\'m not familiar. Everyone else stands back silently.
My gaseous form begins to ache. It feels like it\'s condensing. I fall onto my knees. Eventually, Bek\'Shtii finishes his chant. I breathe heavily, recovering from the discomfort.

I feel for my face. I can feel it. My face is fleshy and solid. My normal, actual face is back. \"Dr. Kaden, you can now switch between your natural, mortal form and your false spirit form freely,\" Bek\'Shtii tells me. I try it, and, sure enough, I can switch between my two forms just by thinking about it. I stay with my mortal form, for the time being.
\"This should help you move around unnoticed without having to possess another person,\" Bek\'Shtii says. \"You have one more new ability. You can grow tentacles from your back. Try it.\"

I try it, and four black, vaporous tentacles come out of my back, two on each side. I can even control them, just like my own arms. \"You can do this even when possessing someone. This might be useful in combat, if you ever need to defend yourself,\" Bek\'Shtii says.
\"You really thought ahead, didn\'t you?\" I smile.

\"I will take that as a \'thank you\',\" Bek\'Shtii responds. \"We may need your assistance in the near future. Considering what we have done for you, we find that reasonable. You are free to go,\" Bek\'Shtii says, dismissing me. I turn and walk away.
\"Have fun with your new powers!\" Sezja says excitedly.
\"Keep your spirits up,\" reminds Va\'Nal.
\"Yeah, bye,\" groans Baqer.
I leave the ancient city and wonder what I will do next. I should probably start by going back home to the Arcticon Research Facility.
I encounter an armed park ranger. \"Are you lost, Sir?\" he asks.
\"No, I went to those ruins over there for a meeting. I\'m on my way out right now,\" I say.
The ranger is confused. \"How did you enter this park?\" he asks.
\"I rode a bus with students earlier today to get in here. I\'m not actually with the school, though,\" I answer truthfully.

\"Sir, if you\'re not authorized to be here, then I have to detain you,\" the ranger says, pointing his gun at me. Okay, I don\'t need to panic. This reminds me of gym class when I was Ananya Sanjeet. What\'s the best thing to do in this situation?
Ah, yes, I remember.
\"Don\'t think about running,\" says the ranger. Well, so much for that idea. I take another look at the ranger. I might be able to take him on, anyway.

\"Turn around and put your hands behind your back,\" says the ranger. I do so. He approaches me and is about to place restraints on my wrists. Just before he does so, however, I figure that I should take advantage of this.
I quickly extend tentacles from my back. I use them to quickly grab the ranger\'s gun away from him.
I pull out the magazine from the gun and crush the magazine with my tentacles into dust.
I hand the unloaded gun back to the ranger. \"It\'s a shame that you\'re just doing your job. Now leave me be,\" I laugh.
\"Who are you?\" asks the ranger.
I change into my spirit form. \"I know you! You were on TV! What are you, exactly? What do you want?\" the ranger gasps.
\"I already told you what I want. I want you to let me leave,\" I respond. The ranger backs away from me. \"You really want to know who I am, don\'t you?\"
\"I am the Phantom of the West!\"
I fly off to the mountains, to Arcticon. As I\'m in the sky, I see the whole western continent.
I see the tall buildings of New Ferando to the southeast.
I see the trees of the Western Continental Park to the west.
I see the snowy mountain range to the northeast, home to Arcticon.
Finally, I see the highway in the middle, connecting it all together.
I reach Arcticon\'s surface entrance. I see a ventilator nearby, so I use it to enter the ventilation system to reach my apartment.
Finally, I\'m back in my own bedroom. I should probably tell Caitlyn and Yukio what I\'ve been doing so far. I switch to my mortal form and head out.
I head over to the staff lounge that Caitlyn and Yukio frequent. It should be their break time soon, and then they\'ll be here.
Break time arrives, and Caitlyn and Yukio enter the lounge shortly thereafter.
\"Oh, there you are,\" says Yukio.
\"Oh, Kadey, Yuki and I were worrying about you. We\'re glad you\'re back,\" says Caitlyn.
\"Yes, and we also saw a man talk about you on television this morning. Do you care to explain?\" Yukio asks.
\"The television? Oh, that man was the first person that I possessed. Caitlyn, you remember when you drove to New Ferando to pick me up, right?\"
Caitlyn nods, \"Yeah, that man was a police officer; wasn\'t he? He looks familiar now, now that you mention it.\"
I continue, \"Well, that might not be the last time that I\'m mentioned on television. Let me explain.\"

I tell Caitlyn and Yukio my story. \"Okay, so I already told you on the phone how I went outside to get some fresh air, right? And that I was about to be seen and that I had to possess a student? Well, after that phone call, I continued going to school the next day as my new self. Then, the day after that, it turned out that we had to go on a field trip to the Western Continental Park. So, we went there, and we went on a boring hike with some tour guides. In the middle of the hike, gaseous tentacles grew out from my back. It turned out that my powers were expanding. The tour guide got scared and he was about to shoot me, but then I used my tentacles to grab his gun, and I crushed it into tiny bits. Then, I came back here. Also, I can switch between my normal self and my spirit self now.\"

\"Okay, okay. That is a lot of information to give us at once. Let me understand the basics. Essentially, you are becoming more powerful, and you let yet another outsider discover your powers. Is that correct?\" asks Yukio.
\"Yeah, basically.\"

Yukio shakes his head and leaves the lounge. \"Don\'t worry too much about Yuki,\" says Caitlyn. \"Also, it seems like you\'ve had an exhausting day. I know just who can help you relax. Stay right there,\" Caitlyn adds, and then leaves the lounge.
Caitlyn comes back, this time holding Foxtrot the Ferret. It\'s always good to see him.
Caitlyn comes back, this time holding Foxtrot the Ferret, one of Arcticon\'s most beloved test animals.
\"Cheer up Dr. Kaden, Foxy!\" encourages Caitlyn.
Foxtrot just stares at me. Foxtrot is usually more forthcoming when he sees me, but he doesn\'t seem as comfortable this time. Can he smell the god\'s blood inside of me?
I decide to leave Foxtrot alone.
\"Foxtrot looks a bit frightened. Maybe you should put him back, Caitlyn,\" I say.
I decide to pet Foxtrot.
Foxtrot pulls his head back as I move my hand towards him. I keep reaching towards him, but then Foxtrot hisses at me. I put my hand back and give up.
Foxtrot pulls his head back at first as I move my hand towards him. I wait a few moments, and Foxtrot puts his head back forward.
I rub his head, and he seems all right with it.
After that, Foxtrot climbs to the top of my shoulder and starts licking my face. Caitlyn laughs, and so do I.
Caitlyn frowns at Foxtrot. \"Oh Foxy, it\'s just Dr. Kaden. Oh well,\" she shrugs and leaves.
I eventually head back to my apartment. I could use a rest.
I decide to go to sleep.
Chapter 10
2 years ago …

Caitlyn, Yukio, Jim, and I had graduated with our doctoral degrees and were at the Kenyon Imperial Hotel, New Ferando\'s flagship hotel. We had just finished eating dinner at the Yí Mǐn Cāntīng, an eastern-continent-style restaurant and one of several restaurants in the Kenyon Hotel. We were walking through one of the hotel\'s major walkways.
\"Where are you going to work?\" Jim asked Yukio.
\"The Arcticon Research Facility is hiring me as a physicist.\" Yukio turned to Caitlyn and me. \"Actually, all three of us were hired there.\"
\"Yup, I\'m going to be a medical researcher there,\" Caitlyn added.

\"Oh, well, I guess that leaves me the odd one out,\" Jim said, scratching his head. \"There\'s a university on the mainland that wants me as an assistant professor. It\'s going to be tough working without you guys anymore.\"
\"We\'ll miss you!\" smiles Caitlyn.

Caitlyn turned around and noticed a sign by the ballroom entrance. \"Kadey, look! The Rescued Animals Foundation is hosting an event in the ballroom right now,\" Caitlyn pointed at the sign, excitedly. \"Oh, I bet they have cute animals in there!\" she continued.
\"You\'ve been calling me \'Kadey\' a lot recently. How come?\" I asked.

\"Oh, well, I guess I like to nickname people as a way of showing affection. You, Yuki, and Jim are all really great friends,\" she blushed, embarrassed. \"Is it okay if I keep calling you \'Kadey\'?\" she asked, worried if she was offending me.
I hesitated. \"… Sure, you can keep calling me \'Kadey\' if you want. It\'s been a long time since someone considered me a \'great friend\' anyway,\" I said.
\"Kaden, you do not need to feel like that. All four of us have gotten along well together, considering all things,\" Yukio said, smiling.
\"So, do you want to go in, Kadey?\" Caitlyn asked. The Kenyon Imperial Hotel\'s ballroom was a popular location for hosting events, so I decided to go with Caitlyn.

There were many people in the ballroom. Among them were representatives from the Rescued Animals Foundation handing out flyers. There were even posters on the wall that mentioned wrongful deaths and abuses of animals, with some other posters saying how we could make a difference.
At the front of the ballroom were rescued domestic animals, with each species enclosed in its own pen. Caitlyn walked along the various pens, and I followed her.
Caitlyn stopped at a pen with ferrets. \"Oh, they\'re so cute!\" she said. \"Let\'s adopt one! How about that one?\" she asked, pointing at one of the ferrets.
\"Come on, Caitlyn. Owning an animal like that is a years-long commitment. We already have ourselves to take care of,\" I replied.
\"Please?\" Caitlyn asked, looking innocently at me.
Chapter 11
\"I hope that you slept well,\" Bek\'Shtii says. \"You\'re back in my room?\" I ask. \"I am. Also, you may be interested in this,\' he says, handing me an invitation flyer.

The flyer is about a reunion for former students of New Ferando State High School, the same school that I attended many years ago. According to the flyer, the reunion will be held in the Kenyon Imperial Hotel ballroom … late tonight!

This could be a problem. I don\'t have much time to prepare. I\'ve already missed several days of work, and I should probably talk to my supervisor about why I\'ll be gone today as well. I don\'t have any proper clothes to wear for this type of social event. I haven\'t even booked a room at the Kenyon Hotel, although perhaps that part isn\'t as important, since I can fly back here. I also have to deal with Sarah Parson. I bet the park ranger who saw me yesterday is going to run to the media, and Sarah, or a co-worker of hers, will interview him, and my reputation will be ruined.

Wait a minute. Sarah went to high school with me. She might go to the reunion tonight. If so, then I could possess Sarah, bias the interview, and go to the reunion as her. I mean, I don\'t have to go to the reunion, but I would be possessing Sarah anyway, and I\'d bet Sarah would have wanted to go. Also, I might see Rebecca there.
I would really like to see Rebecca there.
\"You must have read my mind. Thank you,\" I say to Bek\'Shtii. Bek\'Shtii nods and disappears.
It\'s almost the start of the workday. I head to the laboratory where Caitlyn, Yukio, and I work.

\"Hello, Caitlyn and Yukio. I\'m sorry about all of the worrying that I have caused for either of you. I want to make up for it. I want us to drive to the Kenyon Imperial Hotel. There is a major social event being held there. I will let you see my powers firsthand. How about it?\"
\"Kaden,\" Yukio says, \"we are supposed to work in the laboratory today. Caitlyn and I are not being paid to go on field trips with you. Perhaps you should start working again as well.\"
\"Okay, Yukio. I can call our supervisor and get official permission to go to the hotel today. Would you and Caitlyn go with me then?\"
Yukio shrugs.

I call our supervisor. \"Hello? Supervisor? I might have already called you about this, but the reason that I was absent for the last few days was because of an important field study. I wish to continue my study today, but I also wish for Caitlyn Rylie and Yukio Kiyoshi to accompany me. Is that all right with you?\"
\"Okay, thank you.\" I\'m cleared to go out with Caitlyn and Yukio. I tell them the news, and we leave Arcticon to drive off.
Yukio is driving Caitlyn and me down the highway. It\'s overcast and raining today.

I see a KNFN News van pass by us on the other side of the highway. \"Yukio, a news van just headed by us towards the park. I need to check it out. Keep driving with Caitlyn to the Kenyon Hotel. I\'ll contact you later.\"
I turn into my spirit form and roll down my car window.
I jump out of the window and fly towards the news van.
I land on the van and crawl down to its underside.
The van goes towards the Western Continental Park and passes through the entrance.
The van eventually stops by the lodge. It\'s hard to tell, hiding under the news van, but it looks like the students have already left.
I see Sarah and the news crew walk out of the vehicle. They talk. Eventually, Sarah walks over to the other side of the van, pulls out a handheld mirror from her pocket, and looks at herself.
I take this opportunity to possess Sarah.
I find myself looking at Sarah\'s face in her mirror. I brush my hair back and smirk at my new reflection, before I put the mirror away.
I go back to the news crew and tell them that I\'m ready.
The news crew calls over the park ranger who tried to detain me.
We all get ready for the news report to be filmed, and we go on the air.

I hear a news anchor on my earphone. \"The unidentified man who may have assaulted a New Ferando police officer earlier this week strikes again. Sarah Parson joins us live at the Western Continental Park. Sarah?\"
I respond, \"We are here with a park ranger who says that a man attacked him yesterday afternoon.\" I turn to the ranger. \"So, tell us what happened?\"

\"Well, a coworker of mine was guiding a tour with a group of students. He called me on the radio, saying he saw a black bear who knocked a student unconscious, and he wanted me to investigate while he continued the tour. When I got there, I saw a man in a blue hooded raincoat. I asked him where he came from, and he started answering real aggressively.\"
\"Aggressively? What did he say specifically? Was he just lost or confused?\" I interject.
\"He said he came from the ruins, but the ruins are off-limits. There\'s some very fragile architecture there. I told him I had to detain him.\"
\"You said that you had to detain him? Was he dangerous? He was not armed or anything, was he?\" I ask.
\"It\'s just standard procedure, Ma\'am. We value our park greatly, and take pride in keeping it safe.\"
\"Understandable. Please, go on,\" I nod.

\"I was about to handcuff him, but then he took my gun and pulled out the magazine and damaged it. Then, his face turned to black, and his eyes glowed red. He told me that he was the \'Phantom of the West\', and he ran off.\"
\"He said that his name was the \'Phantom of the West\'? I see. One more thing before we go: if this phantom were here now, what would you want him to know?\"
\"I\'d say he should turn himself in. I don\'t care what kind of powers he has. He has the obligation to act in a civilized manner, just like anyone else.\"
\"Thank you for your time, and I hope that the encounter between you and this phantom was just a misunderstanding,\" I say to the ranger, much to his puzzlement.
I turn to the camera. \"This is Sarah Parson at the Western Continental Park. We will keep you updated with any more news regarding this mysterious, handsome, hooded man, here on KNFN.\"
\"Thank you, Sarah,\" says the news anchor on my earphone.
The news crew and I pack up our equipment and return to the van.

We drive south, to New Ferando. I take off my earphone. I then look through Sarah\'s memories. It seems that she already booked a room at the Kenyon Imperial Hotel so that she wouldn\'t have to drive in the rain at night and deal with New Ferando\'s congested traffic. Sarah also asked to have a short workday today, for the reunion. I tell the crew to drop me off at the Kenyon Imperial Hotel. The hotel and the KNFN headquarters are only a couple blocks away from each other, so it\'s no big deal for them.
We reach the Kenyon Imperial Hotel. I grab my handbag, well, Sarah\'s. I thank the crew and exit onto the sidewalk.
I look for Caitlyn and Yukio and find them near the entrance. \"Hello, Caitlyn and Yukio. It\'s me, Dr. Kaden,\" I say.
\"Dr. Kaden?\" Yukio asks. \"You possessed Sarah Parson? The journalist? I have to wonder if you are doing this to live out some secret fantasy of yours.\"
\"You complimenting my tastes flatters me, Dr. Kiyoshi,\" I say to Yukio, sarcastically.
Yukio reaches into his pocket and pulls out my wallet. \"You left your wallet in my car,\" he says.
I try to take my wallet, but Yukio pulls it back. \"Oh, wait. You are not Dr. Kaden. I am so sorry, Ms. Parson, for mistaking you for him,\" Yukio says, with ridicule.
\"Okay, Yukio, what do you want now?\" I ask.
\"If Caitlyn and I need to stay here, we need a room. Will you promise to book us one and pay for it?\" Yukio asks.
\"Sarah already booked a hotel room for herself. It has two double-sized beds. None of us have to spend any more money,\" I say.
Yukio shakes his head and puts his arm around Caitlyn. \"No. Caitlyn and I need separate rooms. I cannot trust Caitlyn with you anymore.\"
\"Yuki, it\'s fine,\" Caitlyn says, but Yukio ignores her.
\"Okay, fine,\" I give in. Yukio finally gives me my wallet.
We head through the entrance. The Kenyon Hotel\'s lobby is spacious and well decorated. This hotel is a lot better than that small, no-name hotel that I was at earlier this week.
\"We will be by the escalator, while you get us a room,\" Yukio says. I head to the reception desk.
\"Hi, I booked a room here earlier today,\" I say to the receptionist. \"I was wondering if we could book a second room. I have some last-minute companions.\"
\"Sure,\" the receptionist says. She tells me the cost of the second room and asks me to pay.
Now, the question is: do I pay for Yukio\'s and Caitlyn\'s room with my money, or with Sarah\'s money?
I decide to pay with my own money.
I take my payment card out of my wallet and give it to the receptionist. She looks at my card. \"You don\'t look like an \'Alexander Kaden\', Ms.,\" she says.
\"Oh, he\'s … my boyfriend,\" I say to the receptionist.
\"Prove it,\" the receptionist says, folding her arms.
I stare blankly at her.

\"I\'m just kidding,\" she laughs. \"We\'re supposed to check for those things now. You remember all of that identity theft our country had last year, right? You\'re fine, though.\" She hands back my card. \"You\'re Sarah Parson, right? It took me a while to recognize you,\" she says. I nod back.
\"By the way, is this \'Alexander\' cute?\" she asks.
\"Yeah,\" I respond, blushing.
I decide to pay with Sarah\'s money.
I hand Sarah\'s payment card to the receptionist. She looks at Sarah\'s name.
\"Oh, Sarah Parson. You\'re from the news channel, right?\" the receptionist asks, excited.
\"Yeah,\" I smile and nod.
\"Oh, I should have recognized you right away! I\'m a big fan of yours. Can I have your autograph?\" the receptionist asks, handing me a notepad on the desk.
\"Sure thing, lovely follower,\" I say to her. I sign \"Sarah Parson\", imitating Sarah\'s handwriting as well as I can.

\"Thanks,\" says the receptionist. She swipes Sarah\'s card and gives it back. I feel a bit bad, though. As it is, the real Sarah won\'t get to experience her high school reunion, and now, she\'s out some money, just because Yukio\'s being stubborn.
\"Here is your second key, Ms. Parson,\" the receptionist says, handing me a keycard.
I go to Caitlyn and Yukio by the escalator. \"Yukio, I have your keycard,\" I say, to get his attention.

Yukio turns around. \"Thank you,\" he says, taking his keycard. \"I must apologize for my behavior. I was working stressfully all this week, and I have been taking out the stress on you. It is not right.\"

\"Whatever, Yukio,\" I say. I look at my clock. \"It\'s lunchtime. Where should we eat?\" I ask. Caitlyn and Yukio shrug. Well, I guess that it\'s up to me then. Like I said before, the Kenyon Imperial Hotel has several restaurants. Each one serves its own type of cuisine, and each one has a different price range.
It\'s probably best just to get something that will hold me over until the reunion, something affordable. \"Let\'s go to The Habitat,\" I say to Caitlyn and Yukio. They agree, and we go.
We walk through the hotel to get to The Habitat. I\'m walking beside Yukio, and I see him frowning. \"Hey, Yukio, I was just kidding,\" I say to him. \"I really do accept your apology.\" Yukio sighs.
